title: Kyle Tucker's Dodgers contract might have been the final blow for labor peace
content: MLB fans are angry -- and players and owners are, too. What did this offseason mean for baseball's coming labor strife?

title: LeBron oldest with triple-double in NBA history
content: LeBron James broke the record held by Karl Malone in the Lakers' win over the Mavericks on Thursday night.

title: MLB 'proactive' in rushing Venezuelan players back
content: After the U.S. launched a military strike on Venezuela on Jan. 3, MLB teams worked quickly to get their Venezuelan players back to the U.S. ahead of spring training.

title: Ole Miss QB Chambliss eligible for '26, judge rules
content: Ole Miss quarterback Trinidad Chambliss was granted an extra year of eligibility by a state court judge, who issued an injunction that paves the way for Chambliss to be eligible in 2026.

title: Jazz fined $500K, Pacers $100K for sitting players
content: The NBA on Thursday night fined the Utah Jazz $500,000 and the Indiana Pacers $100,000 due to what the league called "management of their rosters for recent games."

title: Source: Patriots to move DC Williams to new role
content: The Patriots are opening their defensive coordinator position by moving Terrell Williams to a high-ranking role on coach Mike Vrabel's staff, a source confirmed.

title: Trump pardons include Klecko, Newton, Lewis
content: President Donald Trump on Thursday pardoned former NFL players Joe Klecko, Nate Newton, Jamal Lewis, Travis Henry and the late Billy Cannon on Thursday.

title: Topic debuts for Thunder after testicular cancer
content: Nikola Topic, who missed all of last season because of a knee injury and had not played this season after a cancer diagnosis, made his debut Thursday.

title: MLB finalizes ABS challenge system for '26 season
content: MLB teams will always have at least one challenge in extra innings as part of the league's new automated ball-strike challenge system for the 2026 season.

content: Which teams might take a quarterback? Could offensive linemen dominate the first round? Field Yates projects the top 32 picks of the 2026 NFL draft.

content: The ACC and the Big 12 will have a say in the field's final teams. For now, the Last Four In all hail from the ACC.

content: The Philadelphia Phillies have released outfielder Nick Castellanos, making him a free agent who can sign with any club for the league minimum.

content: Athletes Unlimited players underscore the importance of housing and retirement plans but swear they won't sweat a missed paycheck or two.

content: Three past MVP QBs -- Rich Gannon, Matt Ryan and Kurt Warner -- weighed in on the issues that impacted Jackson's tumultuous season.

content: Can the Ravens and Chiefs get back on top? How about the Cowboys? We stacked teams that missed the playoffs.

content: Which prospects have entered the draft conversation? Here's the updated top 100 big board for the 2026 class.

title: NASCAR descends on Daytona eager to move on from turbulent offseason, get back to racing
content: It was a heartbreaking offseason for much of NASCAR, and as the garage descends on Daytona, the stock car world is ready to refocus on racing.

title: Busch, 0-for-20 in Daytona 500, captures pole
content: Kyle Busch, who is winless in 20 Daytona 500 starts, earned the pole Wednesday with a lap at 183.925 mph.

title: It was Arsenal's turn to respond in the title race. Instead, flawed display invigorates Man City
content: Arsenal's draw at Brentford only put more pressure on themselves in the Premier League title race as they failed to respond to Man City's recent form.

title: 11 experts predict the 2026 NFL season: Early Super Bowl picks, MVP favorites and more
content: Who will win next season's Super Bowl? Who is set to be the next MVP? We asked NFL experts to make early calls on how 2026 will play out.

title: What's the fantasy baseball impact of 'new homes' for Rays, Royals?
content: Todd Zola breaks down what makes MLB stadiums favor pitching versus hitting, as well as the impact of new stadiums/dimensions being used in 2026.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool monitoring USMNT's Christian Pulisic
content: Liverpool are keeping tabs on United States star Christian Pulisic, whose contract at AC Milan has less than 18 months remaining. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Burning questions: How will the heavyweight division shake out in 2026?
content: With a stable of established veterans and plenty of rising talent at heavyweight, the landscape could be much different by the end of the year.

title: ‚ÄòWe have the edge‚Äô: India spinner‚Äôs bold claim before T20 WC blockbuster vs Pakistan
content: India's dominant win over Namibia bolsters their Group A standing and sets a confident tone for the Pakistan clash. Mystery spinner Varun Chakaravarthy, showcasing improved variations and belief in India's spin attack, feels the team holds a psychological edge. Explosive batting and effective spin bowling were key to the victory, preparing India for their high-stakes encounter.

title: Jharkhand gangster with 50+ cases shot dead by 3 assailants at Dehradun mall
content: A notorious gangster, Vikram Sharma, with over 50 criminal cases, was shot dead by three assailants at Dehradun's Silver City Mall. Sharma, who had criminal ties in Jharkhand and ran a stone crusher plant, was ambushed outside a gym. Police suspect a gang war fueled by past disputes, with a joint team investigating.

title: Google exec on what gives it edge over not just OpenAI, but also Nvidia
content: Google's Chief Technologist for AI Infrastructure highlighted the company's integrated approach to AI development, from custom chips to software, as its key advantage. This co-design strategy allows for faster innovation, as demonstrated by the performance of the new Gemini 3 model. Google is also pursuing ambitious projects like space-based AI data centers to further enhance its capabilities.

title: Connectivity boost for 'Chicken neck'! Underground rail route through Siliguri Corridor
content: Indian Railways is constructing a new 35.76 km underground railway line through the Siliguri Corridor, known as the "Chicken's Neck," to enhance secure and reliable connectivity to the Northeast. This strategically vital project, utilizing modern technology, aims to improve defense logistics and disaster response in the region.

title: After CEO asked employees to stop coding, Nvidia engineers get access to OpenAI's Codex
content: Nvidia has deployed OpenAI's Codex AI coding tool to all 30,000 engineers, marking a significant enterprise rollout. CEO Jensen Huang's mandate to automate tasks with AI is driving this adoption, with engineers praising the tool's ability to handle complex workflows and maintain context.

title: T20 World Cup: India start with wins but batting fragilities exposed
content: India's batting collapses against USA and Namibia in T20 World Cup highlight concerns over adapting to slower pitches against spinners. Opponents have found a blueprint to counter India's powerful batting by mixing tactics and targeting individual batters. The team needs to unlearn habits from flat pitches and prepare for challenging conditions against Pakistan in Colombo.

title: ‚ÄòPlumbers of tech world‚Äô: JPMorgan explains importance of Indian IT sector amid AI turmoil
content: IT sector stocks crash: The correction has been severe, with roughly Rs 5.7 lakh crore in market value wiped out within eight trading sessions and the Nifty IT index declining about 19% over a short period.

title: Why is stock market down today? Nifty50 goes below 25,600; BSE Sensex down 700 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the equity benchmarks, crashed in trade on Friday amid weak global cues and the continued IT stocks selloff. While Nifty50 went below 25,600, BSE Sensex was down over 700 points.

title: American computer scientist, who called OpenAI a Ponzi scheme, writes a long post on AI
content: Computer scientist David Magerman, a veteran of Renaissance Technologies, argues that AI doomsday predictions are overblown hype. He asserts that current LLM-based AI solutions are largely in failing pilot stages and not yet used at scale in production environments.

title: 'Fall in line': Bishnoi gang threatens Ranveer Singh, Rohit Shetty again
content: A key member of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang has issued a fresh audio threat, this time targeting actor Ranveer Singh and filmmaker Rohit Shetty. The gangster warned of severe consequences for Singh, even mentioning his support staff, and urged Bollywood to "fall in line." Security agencies are analyzing the clip amid ongoing industry alerts.

title: T20 World Cup: From Bengaluru to Bay Area, USA's Sanjay Krishnamurthi's journey
content: From watching MS Dhoni's World Cup-winning six in USA to watching a Test match at Chinnaswamy to representing Karnataka U-16 to clearing the ropes at the Wankhede Stadium in the T20 World Cup, Sanjay Krishnamurthy‚Äôs journey is monumental. Balancing a Computer Science degree with franchise cricket, the USA batter is one for the future and even R Ashwin says so.

title: Who will be Bangladesh‚Äôs next PM? Tarique Rahman, once-exiled scion, set to take charge
content: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) claims victory in the nation's first parliamentary election since the 2024 uprising, though final results are pending. The election follows a student-led revolt that ousted former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. BNP leader Tarique Rahman, son of former President Ziaur Rahman and former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia, has returned to lead the party after years abroad.

title: Lauren Kyle turns heads in Milan as Connor McDavid eyes opener
content: Connor McDavid and Team Canada have arrived in Milan for the 2026 Winter Olympics, beginning preparations for their opener against Czechia. McDavid skated on the top line in practice and shared candid remarks about the Olympic Village and adjusting to jet lag. Off the ice, Lauren Kyle‚Äôs Instagram posts offered fans a personal look at life in Milan, highlighting family support and national pride. Canada, led by captain Sidney Crosby, aims to build on last year‚Äôs international success as Olympic competition begins.

title: Bad Bunny, Kendall Jenner spark buzz after Super Bowl LX show
content: Supermodel and Bad Bunny's ex girlfriend, Kendall Jenner, was spotted at Super Bowl LX as the popular Grammy winner took the stage for his controversial record breaking performance at the halftime show. Soon after the show, rumors of the two rekindling their romance have sparked chaos. Amid this, a clip of two leaving in his luxurious car has sparked panic as many believe the two have got back together.

title: Mavericks vs Lakers injury report: Who‚Äôs playing, out and questionable
content: The Dallas Mavericks and Los Angeles Lakers face off with significant injury concerns impacting both teams. Key players like Cooper Flagg for Dallas and Luka Donƒçiƒá and Deandre Ayton for the Lakers are sidelined. Despite absences, the Lakers, led by LeBron James, are favored at home, while Dallas aims to stay in the playoff hunt.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook for today & should you sell on rise?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are struggling to retain higher levels and a sell on rise intra-day strategy is recommended by Jateen Trivedi, VP Research Analyst - Commodity and Currency, LKP Securities.

title: ‚ÄòLong pause, two elbows‚Äô: How Pakistan spinner became T20 WC‚Äôs biggest talking point
content: Pakistan's Usman Tariq is the talk of the T20 World Cup 2026 with his unusual bowling action, featuring a distinct pause. While cleared by testing regarding elbow flex, his unique rhythm has baffled batsmen like Cameron Green and Dewald Brevis.  Tariq's early success, including a hat-trick, makes his unconventional style a key talking point.

title: Bucket of water thrown at historian S Irfan Habib at Delhi University: 'Disturbing, shocking'
content: Historian S Irfan Habib had a bucket of water thrown at him by an unidentified individual during an event at Delhi University's Arts Faculty. The incident occurred while Habib was addressing students at the People's Literature Festival, organized by AISA. AISA alleged ABVP involvement, which ABVP denied, calling the accusations baseless.

title: Threat from father after marriage: Right to marry by choice part of personal liberty, says HC
content: The Court placed the dispute squarely within the framework of personal liberty under Article 21. It noted that marriage is a right which flows from human liberty and individual discretion.

title: Woman who survived Nipah infection dies due to cardiac arrest
content: A Nipah virus survivor in West Bengal has tragically passed away from cardiac arrest after a prolonged coma and lung infection. This incident follows a recent outbreak in the state, though authorities maintain the situation is under control. Nipah, a virus with a high fatality rate, requires supportive treatment and prevention focuses on avoiding bat-contaminated fruits and animal contact.

title: Will Abhishek Sharma be fit in time? Updates fuel suspense before IND-PAK clash
content: India faces a dilemma regarding Abhishek Sharma's fitness for the T20 World Cup clash against Pakistan. While spinner Varun Chakravarthy expressed optimism about his recovery, captain Suryakumar Yadav indicated a more cautious approach, suggesting Abhishek might miss further games.  His availability hinges on his recovery from a stomach infection and his performance in training.

title: 'Will support democratic, inclusive Bangladesh': PM Modi congratulates BNP on 'decisive victory'
content: Prime Minister Modi congratulated Tarique Rahman on the BNP's decisive election victory, pledging India's support for a democratic Bangladesh. The BNP secured a significant majority, signaling a new political era after months of unrest. Rahman, son of a former president, is poised to become prime minister, marking a shift after former PM Sheikh Hasina's departure.

title: At least 7 dead after multi-vehicle collision on Bengaluru ring road
content: A devastating multi-vehicle collision near Sathyawara on Bengaluru's Hoskote-Dabaspet STRR has claimed at least seven lives. The crash, involving a truck, two SUVs, and a motorcycle, left one SUV severely mangled, trapping occupants. Rescue teams are working to free those caught in the wreckage.

title: IT stocks selloff continues! Infosys, TCS crash up to 6% - what‚Äôs driving the massive rout
content: Technology stocks continued their decline on Friday, impacted by AI disruption fears and delayed interest rate cut expectations. The Nifty IT index plunged significantly, with major players like Infosys and TCS experiencing substantial drops.

title: ‚ÄòUncle Jeffrey‚Äô: Top Goldman Sachs lawyer Kathryn Ruemmler resigns over Epstein links
content: Goldman Sachs' Chief Legal Officer, Kathryn Ruemmler, has resigned following the release of emails detailing a close, long-standing relationship with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The documents reveal Ruemmler acted as a confidante and advisor to Epstein, discussing legal strategies and personal matters, contradicting previous claims of a strictly professional connection.

title: Several schools in Delhi get bomb threat emails; security upped
content: Multiple Delhi schools received bomb threats on Friday, triggering immediate security responses from the Delhi Police. Teams were deployed to investigate the calls, with the first received at BD Tamil Education School. Authorities are urging calm as security checks are conducted.

title: BNP set to return to power after 20 years; Jamaat‚Äôs bid falls short ‚Äî Bangladesh election highlights
content: Bangladesh's Nationalist Party appears poised for a landslide victory in the recent parliamentary elections, with preliminary results showing a commanding lead. Party chief Tarique Rahman is expected to become the next Prime Minister. However, the main opposition, the Awami League, has denounced the polls as a 'well-planned farce' and alleged widespread irregularities.

title: Watch: Elderly woman blocks scooter on footpath, internet can‚Äôt stop cheering
content: An elderly woman in Kozhikode bravely confronted a scooter rider attempting to use the footpath to bypass traffic. Standing firm, she asserted the pavement is for pedestrians, not vehicles. Her courageous stand, captured on video, has garnered widespread admiration online, highlighting the importance of respecting public spaces and pedestrian safety.

title: Trapped for 12 hours after bike falls into mud-filled pit, UP man dies
content: A 25-year-old man died after being trapped for nearly 12 hours in a mud-filled pit on a deserted road in Kanpur Dehat. Dhirendra Kumar's motorcycle fell into the pit on Tuesday night, and he was discovered by farmers the next morning. Despite rescue efforts and hospital treatment, he succumbed to his condition.

title: Indian student killed by US officer: Father died 2 days before Rs 262 crore settlement
content: In a somber turn of events, the city of Seattle has agreed to pay $29 million to the grieving family of Jaahnavi Kandula, a bright Telugu student tragically lost to a police car's reckless speed. This settlement emerges just as her father, Constable Kandula Srikanth, passed away‚Äîadding to the family's heartache.

title: 47 times over 200! India's T20 batting numbers are just unreal
content: India showcased their destructive batting prowess with blistering half-centuries from Ishan Kishan and Hardik Pandya, posting a formidable 209/9 against Namibia. Kishan's rapid 61 and Pandya's 52 ensured India maintained momentum, extending their record of 200-plus T20I totals to 47.

title: M&M, Lenskart & more: Stocks to watch out for today
content: CLSA raised M&M's target price, expecting 20% EBITDA CAGR driven by strong utility vehicle leadership and a robust launch pipeline. HSBC initiated a buy on Hindalco, citing management's confidence in plant commissioning despite minor operational setbacks. Citigroup maintained a buy on Divis Laboratories, forecasting continued double-digit growth fueled by new product transitions and strong EBITDA performance.

title: Nurse who contracted Nipah virus dies of secondary infections; 200 contacts test negative
content: A 25-year-old female nurse, infected with the Nipah virus, has died from secondary infections after a 37-day battle. She succumbed to sepsis and other complications at Barasat Hospital. The male nurse, also infected, has recovered and is doing well at home. No close contacts tested positive.

title: How US-returned Bengaluru techie butchered parents in upscale villa
content: A 33-year-old software engineer has been sent for psychiatric evaluation after allegedly stabbing his parents to death in their Bengaluru villa. The accused, Rohan Bhat, appeared mentally unstable and made contradictory statements, leading to his referral to NIMHANS for assessment. The victims, former merchant navy captain Naveen Chandra and dentist Shyamala, were found with multiple stab wounds.

title: Centre rejects Sixth Schedule, statehood for Ladakh, offers 'territorial council'
content: Ladakh's major political groups, LAB and KDA, were informed by the Centre that neither Sixth Schedule status nor statehood will be granted. Instead, a 'territorial council' model was proposed, which leaders dismissed as a 'farce.'  Disagreements arose over the Sixth Schedule's effectiveness and Ladakh's financial viability for statehood.

title: ICC T20 World Cup 2026: Full match schedule for today
content: The ICC Men‚Äôs T20 World Cup 2026 will feature three group matches on February 13: Australia vs Zimbabwe in Colombo, Canada vs UAE in Delhi, and USA vs Netherlands in Chennai. Australia aim to continue their strong start, while Canada and UAE seek their first win. The Netherlands look competitive, and the USA hope to rebound.

title: Father of Indian student killed in U.S. dies just before $29 million settlement
content: A relative said that the family is currently mourning, and it was not appropriate to speak about the settlement money.

title: Youth booked for playing Vijay‚Äôs film song over Palani temple‚Äôs public address system
content: According to temple sources, the youth gained unauthorised access to the microphone station, typically used for security announcements and broadcasting devotional hymns, during a brief period when staff members were away from the desk.

title: Supreme Court asks Himachal Pradesh govt, SEC to hold local body polls by May 31
content: The Bench, however, said that keeping in mind the monsoon and consequential difficulties usually being faced by the hill State, the poll process must be concluded before May 31

content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey has demanded that the ‚ÄúLok Sabha membership of Mr. Gandhi be cancelled and he be debarred from contesting elections for life‚Äù

content: Significantly, the maximum contributor was a peripheral medical college hospital ‚Äì Government Dharmapuri Medical College Hospital ‚Äì which functions as a Non-Transplant Organ Retrieval Centre (NTORC)

title: High Courts cannot order conduct of counselling beyond admission deadline even if medical seats go vacant: Madras HC
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan hold that only the Supreme Court can carve out exceptions in deserving cases

title: Chittoor: Container falls from lorry, crushes car; software engineer killed
content: The container on the lorry, which was travelling at high speed, suddenly leaned to the right and fell onto the car, crushing it along with Anudeep

content: The court impleaded Mr. Murdia in the case and issued notice to the State of Rajasthan. It scheduled the case for further hearing on February 18

title: State Highways begins work on Outer Ring Road in Tirupattur town
content: The new stretch will act as an alternative route for vehicles to reach key towns like Krishnagiri, Dharmapuri, Hosur, Vellore, and Tiruvannamalai without using narrow stretches in Tirupattur town

title: Prisoners in Karnataka sing national anthem, naada geethe twice daily to ‚Äòpromote harmony, discipline and positivity‚Äô
content: Director General of Police (Prisons) Alok Kumar said the initiative aims to ‚Äòreform inmates by encouraging a sense of national and cultural connection‚Äô

title: What explains Bengaluru Metro‚Äôs annual fare hike? | Decode Karnataka
content: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Ltd. (BMRCL) has put on hold the implementation of the proposed annual fare revision for Namma Metro, which was scheduled to come into effect on February 9, 2026.

title: Kerala motivational speaker and former police officer Philip Mampad detained in POCSO case
content: Philip Mampad, known for conducting motivational classes for youngsters through offline and online platforms, was taken into custody following a complaint filed by a minor, say police

title: Lok Sabha adjourned for the day over Opposition protest on Hardeep Singh Puri
content: As soon as the House convened, Opposition members rushed to the well holding placards demanding resignation of Hardeep Singh Puri after his name allegedly figured in the 'Epstein files' released in the U.S.

title: Opposition MPs demand Hardeep Puri's resignation over alleged links with Epstein
content: Hardeep Singh Puri dismissed the allegations as baseless, describing them as "elements of buffoonery" and having "entertainment value"

title: Love in the time of quick commerce: How Valentine‚Äôs Week is driving pressure and loneliness
content: Valentine‚Äôs week has steadily expanded in India, fuelled by social media validation and the speed of delivery platforms that promise love at the tap of a button.

title: Workers join Bharat bandh in Maharashtra, demand to scrap new labour codes
content: ‚ÄúOrganising a legal strike is made difficult, and the government will put you in jail for an illegal strike. Provident Fund contribution is reduced, and working hours can be increased to 12 hours per day,‚Äù said Shailendra Chauhan, General Secretary of Mumbai, CITU

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) mayor elected in Parbhani Municipal Corporation, BJP slams Uddhav Thackeray on his candidature
content: Iqbal Syed‚Äôs victory was secured after Congress and Shiv Sena (UBT) aligned and received the support of independent corporators to achieve the majority mark of 33 in the 65-member house

title: In Visakhapatnam, activity groups turn cafes and parks into weekend cultural hubs
content: Cafes and parks across Visakhapatnam are evolving into weekend meeting grounds for art, ideas and unhurried community life

content: The Agriculture Artificial Intelligence policy promotes the practical use of AI in agriculture and allied sectors and develop the digital infrastructure such as MahaAgriX (Maharashtra Agriculture Data Exchange), AI-enabled traceability systems

content: The three-week recess period will allow standing committees to examine allocations to various central Ministries given in the Union Budget

title: 19 government school students hospitalised after taking excessive dose of iron tablets
content: Investigation is initiated on the matter as the CEO has asked the school to submit the detail report on the incident

content: A preliminary probe revealed that the two-wheeler rider and all six occupants of the XUV died on the spot

content: A deadly and high-intensity explosion had rocked the Red Fort area in New Delhi, killing about 15 people and injuring many more

content: The initiative was aimed at strengthening the coffee value chain and promoting economic empowerment through employment generation

content: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) led by Tarique Rahman hopes India-Bangladesh relations will be strengthened under the new government

title: As multilateralism erodes, India must reframe its foreign policy
content: Multilateral structures and international institutions are withering away as power politics and transactional relationships reshape the new world order; India must reframe foreign policy beyond strategic autonomy, build endogenous capabilities, diversify trade, and pursue Viksit Bharat 2047

title: Telangana Municipal Polls 2026 LIVE: Congress takes lead as results trickle in
content: The final voter turnout for the elections held on February 11, 2026, was 73.01%, according to information from Telangana State Election Commission

title: How Indira Canteens lost flavour among patrons in Bengaluru
content: A flagship programme of the Congress government in Karnataka to provide affordable and regular meals for all, Indira Canteens today are a shadow of their former glorious selves despite repeated promises of revival, writes Rishita Khanna

content: The petitioner submitted that the property had already been declared a Waqf and despite this, third parties were  seeking permission to conduct pujas on specific occasions

title: VB-G RAM G: when a policy shift meets rural realities
content: While the Centre maintains that VB-G RAM G is an improved version of MGNREGA, critics  say it dilutes the legal right to employment guaranteed under the earlier law. The primary stakeholders, the job card holders, may not be familiar with the technical details of the new Act, but their concern is straightforward: they want assured and adequate work so that the scheme genuinely serves its purpose of livelihood security, finds out P. Sujatha Varma

title: Student from Kolkata living in Bangladesh for 5 years expects peace to return now to that country
content: According to him, anti-India sentiments also seemed to be slowly losing its grip on the citizens, with many people beginning to talk about the good relationship that the two countries once enjoyed

title: Durgam cheruvu: A glittering view, a gasping lake
content: The gem-like appearance of Durgam Cheruvu hides a sinister, calculated assault. As evening lights and rooftop views sell the lake as a tourist spot, a multi-agency process seems to be killing it softly. One civic body lowers the water level to free up land, another lays a 10-metre-wide walking track on the exposed lake bed and yet another releases organically loaded effluents that fuel decay. Once a source of drinking water and part of Golconda Fort‚Äôs hydrological system, the lake is now trapped in a bureaucratic tic-tac-toe, writes¬†Serish Nanisetti

title: Nagaland tribe resolves to protect pangolins
content: The Sangtam community‚Äôs initiative is seen as a major step for conservation of the world‚Äôs most trafficked wild mammal for its scales and meat

content: According to a press release, traffic diversion for vehicles is aimed at facilitating free flow of traffic on key routes in the district

title: Southern Railway installs digital display boards but without real time data of arrival of suburban trains
content: While commuters welcome the digital display boards initiative, they point out that these display boards would not be of much use unless they provide real time data on the arrival of suburban trains

title: Udhayanidhi Stalin felicitates U-19 cricketers
content: R.S. Ambrish and Deepesh Devendran were part of the Indian team that won the U19 Cricket World Cup recently

title: Midday meal cooks protest in Chhattisgarh: 47 days of striking for fair honorarium
content: Hundreds of midday meal cooks in Chhattisgarh have been protesting since December 29, demanding an increase their honorarium of ‚Çπ2,000 a month; they demand job security and a sum of money that will cover at least their basic daily expenses

content: Ranjana Jha, his first wife, said that she had also filed cases in the Family Court in Supaul and approached the Women‚Äôs Commission

title: Angela Merkel to deliver first Manmohan Memorial Lecture

title: FOMRRA submits people‚Äôs manifesto to political parties
content: The manifesto outlines critical demands, including improved drainage systems, 24/7 potable water access, establishing a multi-specialty hospital and fire stations, among other demands

title: Giving 2.20 lakh digital title deeds in unrecognised habitations in two years is a record for Karnataka, says Revenue Minister
content: As the government is gearing up to provide digital title deeds for properties of over 1.1 lakh families in unrecognised habitations in Karnataka, on February 14 in Haveri, it is set to create a record of sorts

title: Karnataka High Court directs State government to set up Municipal Trust Property Management System to protect public properties
content: Pointing out that public properties controlled by various municipalities are not maintained and protected as mandated by law, the High Court of Karnataka directed the State government to set up and operationalise a Municipal Trust Property Management System, as a single source of truth for all such properties across the State and assign a Trust Property Identification Number

title: SIT starts fresh sample collection in gold theft probe at Sabarimala
content: SIT, assisted by personnel from the Legal Metrology department, forensic laboratory, and skilled artisans, began removing gold-plated covering from artefacts in the sanctum sanctorum¬†and its pillars on Thursday evening

title: Fire breaks out in building in Naval Dockyard in south Mumbai
content: An official said the spot where the fire erupted was situated diagonally opposite the Gateway of India in Colaba

title: Racing activities of Bangalore Turf Club to move to Kunigal Stud Farm
content: The existing turf club in the heart of Bengaluru will be turned into a lung space; BTC will be given two years to move to the Stud Farm

title: Left parties, trade unions vow to fight against Centre‚Äôs ‚Äòanti-worker‚Äô policies
content: They demand that the Central government repeal the four Labour Codes, fix a minimum wage of ‚Çπ30,000, and strictly implement labour laws

content: The court agrees with Tamil Nadu‚Äôs contention that the slot of DGP on the UPSC empanelment committee should not remain vacant merely because the acting DGP is also a candidate in the zone of consideration

title: Nationwide strike draws 30 crore participants, say trade unions
content: The strike call, issued jointly by the central trade unions and the Samyukt Kisan Morcha, was to protest against the recent slew of FTAs, Labour Codes; strike actions reported from 600 districts, unions say

title: Now, airlines oppose relaxed duty norms for cabin crew
content: Federation of Indian Airlines (FIA), in a letter to DGCA, opposes expansion of definition of night duty from midnight‚Äì5 a.m. to midnight‚Äì6 a.m., scheduling of weekly off at crew members‚Äô home base, and calls for single-room accommodation during layovers instead of shared rooms.

title: Cabinet nod for Shakti scheme smart cards to streamline zero ticket system
content: Introduced on June 11, 2023, as the first of the Congress government‚Äôs five guarantees, the Shakti Scheme allows women, including transgender persons and students, to travel free of cost on non-premium State-run buses

title: Did Sonam Wangchuk see videos cited as proof for detention under NSA, Supreme Court asks Govt.
content: Additional Solicitor General K.M. Nataraj told the top court that the authorities banked on 23 videos to order the detention of Sonam Wangchuk, and everything was supplied to the activist

title: Childhood cancer cases spiking steadily in Karnataka; 1,882 estimated cases in 2025
content: Childhood cancers make up about 2.1% of all new cancers detected annually in Karnataka, where roughly 89,215 new cancer cases were recorded in 2025

title: T.N. will give NDA a ‚Äòzero‚Äô for denying funds due to State: CM Stalin
content: In a post on X, Mr. Stalin asked: ‚ÄúDid they think we would sit back with folded hands and watch even if they gave Tamil Nadu zero in the Budget?‚Äù

title: In the age of AI, governing decisions matters more than governing infra, say experts
content: They argue that as AI systems influence real-time decisions across sectors, traditional governance, risk, and compliance models are yet to catch up, exposing organisations to new and poorly understood risks

title: This AI Model "Was Ready To Kill Someone" When Told It Would Be Shut Down
content: As the world debates the rise and accompanying dangers of artificial intelligence, a startling new revelation has come to light about its deeply disturbing behavioural tendencies.

title: Riyadh To Doha In 2 Hours: All You Need To Know About 300 kmph Bullet Train
content: Saudi Arabia and Qatar are taking a major step towards enhancing regional connectivity with the approval of a high-speed electric rail link between the two countries.

title: CCTV Shows Car Running Over Madhya Pradesh Man Twice, Then Fleeing
content: A shocking CCTV video from Madhya Pradesh's Raisen district shows a man being run over by a car in the early hours on Wednesday.

title: Broken Spine, Leg Crushed: Truck Runs Over People Dancing In Baraat
content: An uninvited guest, in the form of a marauding truck, crashed into a wedding procession, turning joy to screams. The incident occurred in Chhattisgarh's Janjgir-Champa district.

title: White-Collar Jobs Will Be Automated In 18 Months, Warns Microsoft AI Chief
content: Most white-collar jobs may be automated by artificial intelligence (AI) in the next 12 to 18 months, Microsoft AI chief Mustafa Suleyman has warned.

title: Bajaj Finance Taps AI To Handle 100 Million Customer Calls By Next Year
content: Bajaj Finance has already processed 20 million customer calls using AI-powered systems. Over the next year, it is expected to rise to 100 million calls.

title: Agenda To Schedule: All You Need To Know About India AI Impact Summit 2026
content: The India AI Impact Summit 2026 is all set to take place from February 16-20 at the Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi.

title: Amit Shah To Visit International Border In Assam On February 21
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will visit the India-Bangladesh international border in Assam's Cachar district on February 21.

title: 2 Weeks Since US Anchor's Mother Disappeared, FBI Shares Suspect's Pic
content: Nearly two weeks have passed since Nancy Guthrie, the mother of NBC anchor and Today' show host Savannah Guthrie, went missing. The 84-year-old is believed to have been taken from her Arizona home.

title: 30,000 Nvidia Engineers Get Coding Tool Access In Push For Internal AI Use
content: NVIDIA has rolled out generative artificial intelligence (AI) tools to a vast portion of its engineering workforce, integrating OpenAI's agentic coding tool Codex into daily development workflows.

title: Hyderabad Man, 27, Becomes Chain Snatcher To Fund Online Gaming Addiction
content: Hyderabad Police's Commissioner's Task Force cracked a daylight chain-snatching case, arresting a 27-year-old man who had allegedly turned to crime to fund his growing addiction to online gaming.

title: How Madeleine McCann, Who Vanished 19 Years Ago, Entered The Epstein Dossier
content: Nearly two decades after three-year-old Madeleine McCann vanished from a holiday apartment in southern Portugal, her name has surfaced in the newly released documents connected to the disgraced financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Bangladesh Election Results 2026 Live Updates: BNP Registers Landslide Win, India, Pak, US Congratulate Tarique Rahman
content: Bangladesh Election Results LIVE: Steered by a leader back to the country after a 17-year exile,¬†Tarique Rahman-led¬†BNP raced towards a decisive win in the crucial national election held on Thursday.

title: 3 Delhi Schools Receive Bomb Threat Emails, Searches Underway
content: At least three schools in Delhi received bomb threat emails on Friday morning, prompting authorities to launch search operations, a Delhi Fire Services (DFS) official said.

title: What Went Wrong For Hardline Jamaat-E-Islami In Bangladesh Elections
content: In the weeks leading up to Bangladesh's general election on February 12, few parties projected confidence as assertively as the Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami.

title: Class 12 Student Returning From Farewell Runs Over 5 In Lucknow, 6-Year-Old Dies
content: A Class 12 student returning from a farewell party allegedly lost control of his speeding car in Lucknow, hitting a parked bike and then running over several people. The incident left a six-year-old boy dead and four others injured.

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 13 Live Updates: Lok Sabha Proceedings Adjourn, 1st Phase Of Budget Session Concludes Today
content: Parliament Budget Session Live Updates: The Lok Sabha proceedings were adjourned today to meet again on March 9 for the second part of the Budget Session of the Parliament.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Virginia Tech gets biggest victory yet with Clemson upset
content: the 2026 men's NCAA tournament is rapidly approaching . we'll use a variety of metrics as guides, classifying teams based on how likely they are to make the field of 68 as one of the 37 at-large selections . the selection committee will evaluate a team's underlying potential .

title: Chloe Kim falls short of snowboarding history and more
content: American snowboarder Chloe Kim fell just short of history at the Winter Olympics on Thursday. Kim, who was trying to become the first snowboarder to win three straight Olympic gold medals with a victory in the women's halfpipe final, looked to be well on track after an 88.00 in her first run. A fall in her second run left her vulnerable, however, and 17-year-old South Korean Choi Ga-on took advantage, scoring a 90.25 in her third run. Kim was unable to overcome that deficit, falling in her third run. The preliminary round for men's ice hockey began with the U.S. and Canada among countries in action. The U.S. team hasn't won gold in men's Olympic hockey since 1980, but this year it's gold medal or bust. "That's the expectation," captain Auston Matthews  said . Both the U.S. and Canada got started on the right foot in their openers, winning 5-1 and 5-0, respectively. MORE:   Medal tracker  |  Full schedule of events  |  Olympics 101 Below are the top moments from Thursday's events.
